title: How to Draw a Banana Split

steps.headline: Start with a sketch of the ice-cream’s outline.
steps.description: Draw a semicircle with a smaller semicircle oriented opposite of it, with a cone shape under that. The result should be football-shaped and sitting on what looks like a round pedestal.

steps.headline: Sketch in more details.
steps.description: Inside the big semicircle draw a banana shape and three egg shapes. Despite the fact that they're ice cream scoops, retaining the egg shapes is useful for adding toppings later on, so keep them that way for now

steps.headline: Outline the sketch neatly.
steps.description: Make the shape of the bowl over the small semicircle and the cone. Carefully erase whatever remains of the sketch. The banana slices should be outlined so that the one in the front is more visible than on the other side, which sticks out just a little to the right.

steps.headline: Add more details.
steps.description: Draw dripping syrups over the ice cream scoops, dollops of whipped cream sprinkled with chocolate sprinkles, chopped peanuts, and a maraschino cherry on top.

steps.headline: Outline the drawing with a black liner.
steps.description: Try to make a modular line and keep your lines very clean and even.

steps.headline: Erase the pencil from your drawing and color in.
steps.description: Vivid coloring usually looks better––brilliant yellow for the bananas, succulent-looking chocolate ice cream and sprinkles, and pristine white for the dish.

text: Start with a sketch of the ice-cream’s outline. Draw a semicircle with a smaller semicircle oriented opposite of it, with a cone shape under that. The result should be football-shaped and sitting on what looks like a round pedestal. Sketch in more details. Inside the big semicircle draw a banana shape and three egg shapes. Despite the fact that they're ice cream scoops, retaining the egg shapes is useful for adding toppings later on, so keep them that way for now Outline the sketch neatly. Make the shape of the bowl over the small semicircle and the cone. Carefully erase whatever remains of the sketch. The banana slices should be outlined so that the one in the front is more visible than on the other side, which sticks out just a little to the right. Add more details. Draw dripping syrups over the ice cream scoops, dollops of whipped cream sprinkled with chocolate sprinkles, chopped peanuts, and a maraschino cherry on top. Outline the drawing with a black liner. Try to make a modular line and keep your lines very clean and even. Erase the pencil from your drawing and color in. Vivid coloring usually looks better––brilliant yellow for the bananas, succulent-looking chocolate ice cream and sprinkles, and pristine white for the dish.
